channel.title: The Music of Don Gillis II
channel.description:
This series features the works of Don Gillis; hosted by the composer himself. Most of the performances are conducted by the composer.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

image.title: The Music of Don Gillis II

item.title: Prayer and Hymn for Solemn Occasion and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Prayer and Hymn for Solemn Occasion; and Ceremony of Allegiance.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Cracker Barrel
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: The Cracker Barrel March; Downbeat; Frolic in B-Bop Minor; and Bing, Bang, Bong.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Strictly for Strads
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Strictly for Strads; First Movement from Symphony No. II; Third Movement from Symphony No. II
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Symphony No. 6 and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Symphony No. 6, The Tortoise and the Hare; Prairie Sunset; and Mr. Big.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Second Movement from Symphony No. II and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Second Movement from Symphony No. II; To an Unknown Soldier; First Movement from Symphony No. VI; Second Movement from Symphony No. VI
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Soliloquy for Strings and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions:Soliloquy for Strings; and Alice in Orchestralia.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Joyful and Triumphant
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Selections from Joyful and Triumphant; The Shepherd; music from Coming of the King; and Prayer and Hymn for Peace.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Program 16 of 26
item.description: Five Piece Combo; Shindig - A Ballet of the Old West
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Lone Star and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Lone Star; Hymn Song for Sunday; and Herman, the Frog Who Sang at the Met.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Bing, Bang, Bong
item.description: This program, the second in the series, features a performance of "Bing Bang Bong," and "The Raven," both by the NBC Symphony Orchestra, conductd by Dr. Roy Shield. It also includes "Finale" from "Symphony No. 5," with Dr. Orien Dalley conducting.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Music influenced by the blues
item.description: This program focuses on Don Gillis' compositions that were influenced by the blues. This program includes: Blues from Symphony No. 6; Take Five Blues from Woodwind Quintet No. III; Three Time Blues; Blues from The Encore Concerto; and Deep Blues from Symphony No. 8.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: It Shouldn't Happen to a Dog
item.description: This program includes It Shouldn't Happen to a Dog, a fantasy in which the animals of the world have decided to form their own symphony orchestra.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: The Mighty Mac
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: The Mighty Mac; Minuet-Cetera; Razzle Dazzle; Uncle Walt's Waltz; The Pleasant Years; and January February March.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Bandstand in the park
item.description: This program features performances of Don Gillis compositions written for band.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Seven Golden Texts and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Sinfonia for Brass; Seven Golden Texts and A Song of Praise from Psalms of David.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Three Sketches for Strings and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions:Three Sketches for Strings, conducted by Dr. George Wilson; Sermonette, Southern Style; Dialogue for Trombone and Band.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: The Panhandle Suite and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: A 1938 recording of The Panhandle Suite, along with short choral pieces and short movements.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Paul Bunyan and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: a movement from Paul Bunyan; and Atlanta Suite.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Program 17 of 26
item.description: Ballet for Band; Lone Star; Hymnsong for Sunday; Mr. Big (Concert March)
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Portrait of a Frontier Town and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Portrait of a Frontier Town; Tango Lullaby; and Four Scenes from Yesterday.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Opera
item.description: This program focuses on Don Gillis' compositions that were influenced by the American opera.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: A Short Overture to an Unwritten Opera
item.description: This program, the first in the series, focuses on Don Gillis', "A Short Overture to an Unwritten Opera," as well as his "Amarillo: Symphonic Sketches in Honor of a Western City."
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Main Street Saturday Night and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Don Gillis compositions: Main Street Saturday Night; Five Acre Pond; and Symphony No. 5 1/2.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: In Memoriam
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions:In Memoriam; and The Alamo.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Waltz of Sorts and more
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Waltz of Sorts; and In Memoriam.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Rhapsody for Harp and Orchestra
item.description: This program features performances of the following Gillis compositions: Rhapsody for Harp and Orchestra; Tulsa: and A Symphonic Portrait in Oil.
item.dc:creator: Gillis, Don, 1912-1978
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts
